outputs.output_descr:
Restoring livelihoods and building community resilience in drought affected regions of Oromia (Borena)
The overall objective of the project is to contribute to saving lives by providing critical water resources, through emergency animal health intervention, emergency restocking and combining this with productivity-enhancing interventions so as to improve food security in drought affected areas of Borena Zone, Oromiya Region, Ethiopia. The activities will be synchronized with the October-November Hagaya rain so that vaccinations and treatments will be effective and boost the immunity of animals. Water points will also catch more water from the expected rain.  Therefore, all activities are complimentary to each other and will be effective from October 2011 onwards

project_title: Emergency support for drought affected comunities Borena
